alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 8:53AM CDT until June 14 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Franklin County in west central Arkansas... Northeastern Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas... Southwestern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... * Until 945 AM CDT. * At 852 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southwest of Strickler, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Mountainburg... Winslow... Chester... Devils Den State Park... Lake Fort Smith... Strickler... Blackburn... Fern... Bidville... Piney... Locke... Odell... Mount Gayler... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas near mile marker 26. Interstate 49 between mile markers 31 and 46. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
